SEARCH
Package database

Class SQL

java.lang.Object
database.SQL
public class SQL extends Object
Class that facilitates interactions with the database, this includes functions that query and modify values within the database.

  • Method Details

    • setConnection

      public void setConnection() throws SQLException
      Sets the connection with PostgresSQL by giving DriverManager the database URL, username, and password
      Throws:
      SQLException - if an error occurs

    • closeConnection

      public void closeConnection() throws SQLException
      Closes the database connection
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database access error occurs

    • setEmployeeNewEmployee

      public static void setEmployeeNewEmployee(int id, String name, String email, boolean is_cashier, boolean is_manager, LocalDateTime time) throws SQLException
      Inserts a new employee record into the 'employees' table with the provided details.
      Parameters:
      id - the unique identifier for the employee
      name - the name of the employee
      email - the email address of the employee
      is_cashier - flag indicating whether the employee is a cashier
      is_manager - flag indicating whether the employee is a manager
      time - the timestamp of the employee's clock-in time
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database access error occurs or the SQL statement fails to execute

    • getEmployeeAvailableID

      public static int getEmployeeAvailableID() throws SQLException
      Retrieves the next available employee ID by determining the highest existing ID in the 'employees' table and incrementing it by 1.
      Returns:
      the next available employee ID
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database error occurs

    • insert_into_junction_table

      public static void insert_into_junction_table(String menuItemName, String inventoryItemName) throws SQLException
      Inserts a relationship between a menu item and an inventory item into the junction table. This method creates a new association in the database, linking a menu item with an inventory item.
      Parameters:
      menuItemName - the name of the menu item to be linked
      inventoryItemName - the name of the inventory item to be linked
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database access error occurs or the SQL statements are incorrect

    • delete_from_junction_table

      public static void delete_from_junction_table(String menuItemName, String inventoryItemName) throws SQLException
      Deletes a relationship between a menu item and an inventory item from the junction table. This method removes an association from the database, unlinking a menu item from an inventory item.
      Parameters:
      menuItemName - the name of the menu item to unlink
      inventoryItemName - the name of the inventory item to unlink
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database access error occurs or the SQL statements are incorrect

    • get_relationship_names

      public static ArrayList<String> get_relationship_names(String menuItemString) throws SQLException
      Retrieves the names of all inventory items related to a given menu item. This method queries the database for all inventory items that are linked to the specified menu item.
      Parameters:
      menuItemString - the name of the menu item for which related inventory items are sought
      Returns:
      an ArrayList of strings containing the names of related inventory items
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database access error occurs or the SQL statements are incorrect

    • check_inventory_item_existence

      public static boolean check_inventory_item_existence(String itemName)
      Checks whether an inventory item exists in the database. This method queries the database to determine if the specified inventory item is present.
      Parameters:
      itemName - the name of the inventory item to check for existence
      Returns:
      true if the item exists in the database; false otherwise

    • sendTicket

      public static boolean sendTicket(double total) throws SQLException
      Sends a ticket to the database. It inserts new items into the 'item_ordered' table, adds a new order to the 'customer_order' table, and updates the 'inventory_items' table by subtracting the ordered quantities. It processes all items in the ticket, handles inventory deductions for each item, and clears the ticket after processing.
      Parameters:
      total - the total cost of all items ordered in the ticket
      Returns:
      a boolean flag indicating if the ticket was sent without error to the database
      Throws:
      SQLException - if there is an error in accessing the database or executing the update queries

    • getItemsForCategory

      public static ArrayList<String> getItemsForCategory(int categoryID) throws SQLException
      Retrieves a list of item names from the 'menu_item' table that belong to a specific category.
      Parameters:
      categoryID - the ID of the category for which to retrieve the item names
      Returns:
      an ArrayList of item names belonging to the specified category
      Throws:
      SQLException - if there is an error executing the query

    • getItem

      public static MenuItem getItem(String itemName)
      Retrieves a single MenuItem object from the 'menu_item' table based on the item's name.
      Parameters:
      itemName - the name of the menu item to retrieve
      Returns:
      a MenuItem object populated with data retrieved from the database

    • getMenuItemID

      public static int getMenuItemID(String itemName) throws SQLException
      Retrieves the 'menu_item_id' for a given item name from the 'menu_item' table.
      Parameters:
      itemName - the name of the menu item for which to retrieve the ID
      Returns:
      the ID of the menu item, or -1 if the item does not exist
      Throws:
      SQLException - if there is an error executing the query

    • getInventoryItemID

      public static int getInventoryItemID(String itemName) throws SQLException
      Retrieves the database ID for a given inventory item based on its name. This method queries the database to find the unique identifier associated with the inventory item.
      Parameters:
      itemName - the name of the inventory item whose ID is being retrieved
      Returns:
      the ID of the inventory item, or -1 if the item does not exist
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database access error occurs or the SQL statement is incorrect

    • getCategoryID

      public static int getCategoryID(String categoryName) throws SQLException

      Parameters:
      categoryName - the name of the category for which to retrieve the ID
      Returns:
      the ID of the category, or -1 if the category does not exist
      Throws:
      SQLException - if there is an error executing the query

    • getItemOrderAvailableID

      public static int getItemOrderAvailableID() throws SQLException
      Retrieves the next available 'item_ordered_id' from the 'item_ordered' table. It finds the maximum 'item_ordered_id' value and increments it by one to ensure a unique ID.
      Returns:
      the next available 'item_ordered_id'
      Throws:
      SQLException - if there is an error executing the query

    • getInventoryAvailableID

      public static int getInventoryAvailableID() throws SQLException
      Retrieves the next available 'inventory_item_id' from the 'inventory_items' table. It finds the maximum 'inventory_item_id' value and increments it by one to ensure a unique ID.
      Returns:
      the next available 'inventory_item_id'
      Throws:
      SQLException - if there is an error executing the query

    • getCustomerOrderAvailableID

      public static int getCustomerOrderAvailableID() throws SQLException
      Retrieves the next available 'order_id' from the 'customer_order' table. It calculates this by finding the maximum current 'order_id' and adding one.
      Returns:
      the next available 'order_id' for a new customer order
      Throws:
      SQLException - if there is an error executing the query

    • getMenuItemAvailableID

      public static int getMenuItemAvailableID() throws SQLException
      Retrieves the next available 'menu_item_id' from the 'menu_item' table. It determines this by finding the maximum current 'menu_item_id' and incrementing by one.
      Returns:
      the next available 'menu_item_id' for a new menu item
      Throws:
      SQLException - if there is an error executing the query

    • checkPin

      public static boolean checkPin(String pin) throws SQLException
      Checks if a given pin exists in the 'employees' table and returns true if it does.
      Parameters:
      pin - the pin number to check against employee IDs in the database
      Returns:
      true if the pin matches an existing employee's ID, otherwise false
      Throws:
      SQLException - if there is an error executing the query

    • getMenuItems

      public static ArrayList<MenuItem> getMenuItems()
      Retrieves a list of all menu items from the database, including their details and associated category.
      Returns:
      an ArrayList of MenuItem objects, each representing a menu item and its associated category

    • getCustomerOrders

      public static ArrayList<CustomerOrder> getCustomerOrders(int limit)
      Retrieves a limited list of customer orders from the database, ordered by the order ID in descending order. Includes order details and the name of the employee who handled the order.
      Parameters:
      limit - the maximum number of customer orders to retrieve
      Returns:
      an ArrayList of CustomerOrder objects, each representing a customer's order

    • getInventoryItemsUsedInTime

      public static ArrayList<Map.Entry<String,Integer>> getInventoryItemsUsedInTime(Date start, Date end)
      Calculates and returns a list of inventory items used within a specified time period, along with the quantity used. This method queries the database to determine the usage of inventory items between two dates.
      Parameters:
      start - the starting date of the time period
      end - the ending date of the time period
      Returns:
      an ArrayList containing Map.Entry pairs of inventory item names and their respective counts

    • getInventoryItems

      public static ArrayList<InventoryItem> getInventoryItems()
      Retrieves a list of all inventory items from the database, including their details such as current stock, item name, quantity type, reorder level, and price.
      Returns:
      an ArrayList of InventoryItem objects, each representing an inventory item

    • getMenuItemsInDateRange

      public static ArrayList<Map.Entry<String,Integer>> getMenuItemsInDateRange(int startDay, int startMonth, int startYear, int endDay, int endMonth, int endYear)
      Retrieves menu items and their sales quantities within a specified date range. This method queries the database to determine the total quantity sold for each menu item between two dates.
      Parameters:
      startDay - the starting day of the date range
      startMonth - the starting month of the date range
      startYear - the starting year of the date range
      endDay - the ending day of the date range
      endMonth - the ending month of the date range
      endYear - the ending year of the date range
      Returns:
      an ArrayList containing Map.Entry pairs of menu item names and their total quantities sold

    • getInventoryItems

      public static ArrayList<Map.Entry<String,Integer>> getInventoryItems(Date startDate, Date endDate)
      Generates a report of inventory items where less than 10% of their stock was used within a given time frame. This function queries the database to identify inventory items that have been underutilized, assuming no restocking has occurred during the specified period.
      Parameters:
      startDate - The starting date of the analysis period.
      endDate - The ending date of the analysis period, typically the current time.
      Returns:
      An ArrayList containing Map.Entry pairs, where each pair consists of an inventory item's name and its usage count.

    • getMenuItemPairsInDateRangeWithNames

      public static ArrayList<MenuItemPair> getMenuItemPairsInDateRangeWithNames(int startYear, int startMonth, int startDay, int endYear, int endMonth, int endDay) throws SQLException
      Identifies pairs of menu items that are frequently ordered together within a specific date range. This function queries the database to find combinations of menu items that commonly appear in the same orders. It returns these pairs along with the frequency of their co-occurrence.
      Parameters:
      startYear - The start year of the period for analysis.
      startMonth - The start month of the period for analysis.
      startDay - The start day of the period for analysis.
      endYear - The end year of the period for analysis.
      endMonth - The end month of the period for analysis.
      endDay - The end day of the period for analysis.
      Returns:
      An ArrayList of MenuItemPair, where each MenuItemPair includes the names of the two menu items and the count of their joint occurrences.
      Throws:
      SQLException - If there is a database access error or the SQL query is incorrect.

    • setClockIn

      public static boolean setClockIn(String pin)
      Clocks in an employee by updating their 'clocked_in' timestamp in the database based on the provided PIN.
      Parameters:
      pin - the PIN of the employee to clock in
      Returns:
      true if the clock-in operation was successful, false otherwise

    • updateMenuItems

      public static void updateMenuItems(ArrayList<MenuItem> menuItems) throws SQLException
      Updates the details of a list of menu items in the database. This includes updating the item name, price, and category ID for each menu item based on its menu item ID.
      Parameters:
      menuItems - an ArrayList of MenuItem objects with updated details to be persisted to the database
      Throws:
      SQLException - if there is an error executing the update operations

    • updateCustomerOrders

      public static void updateCustomerOrders(ArrayList<CustomerOrder> customerOrders) throws SQLException
      Updates the details of a list of customer orders in the database. This includes updating various order details such as employee ID, total price, order timing (hour, day, week, month, year), and order status for each customer order based on its order ID.
      Parameters:
      customerOrders - an ArrayList of CustomerOrder objects with updated details to be persisted to the database
      Throws:
      SQLException - if there is an error executing the update operations

    • updateInventoryItems

      public static void updateInventoryItems(ArrayList<InventoryItem> inventoryItems) throws SQLException
      Updates the details of a list of inventory items in the database. This includes updating item name, price, current stock, quantity type, and reorder level for each inventory item.
      Parameters:
      inventoryItems - an ArrayList of InventoryItem objects with updated details to be persisted to the database
      Throws:
      SQLException - if there is an error executing the update operations

    • deleteMenuItem

      public static void deleteMenuItem(int id)
      Deletes a menu item from the database based on the provided menu item ID.
      Parameters:
      id - the ID of the menu item to be deleted

    • deleteCustomerOrder

      public static void deleteCustomerOrder(int id)
      Deletes a customer order from the database based on the provided employee ID.
      Parameters:
      id - the ID of the employee associated with the customer order to be deleted

    • deleteInventoryItem

      public static void deleteInventoryItem(int id)
      Deletes an inventory item from the database based on the provided inventory item ID.
      Parameters:
      id - the ID of the inventory item to be deleted

    • addMenuItem

      public static void addMenuItem(MenuItem item)
      Adds a new menu item to the database with the provided details from the MenuItem object.
      Parameters:
      item - the MenuItem object containing the details of the menu item to be added

    • addInventoryItem

      public static void addInventoryItem(InventoryItem item)
      Adds a new inventory item to the database with the provided details from the InventoryItem object.
      Parameters:
      item - the InventoryItem object containing the details of the inventory item to be added

    • addCustomerOrder

      public static void addCustomerOrder(CustomerOrder item)
      Adds a new customer order to the database with the provided details from the CustomerOrder object.
      Parameters:
      item - the CustomerOrder object containing the details of the customer to be added

    • getPeakDays

      public static ArrayList<Map.Entry<String,Double>> getPeakDays()
      Identifies the top 5 days with the highest sales totals. This method queries the database to find the days on which the total sales were the highest, summarizing the data across all orders.
      Returns:
      An ArrayList containing Map.Entry pairs, where each pair consists of a date (as a String in 'month-day-year' format) and the total sales (as a Double) for that date.

    • getSalesPerCategory

      public static ArrayList<Map.Entry<String,Integer>> getSalesPerCategory()
      Calculates the total sales quantity for each category. This method aggregates sales data by category, summing up the quantity of items sold for each category to provide a summary of which categories are selling the most in terms of quantity.
      Returns:
      An ArrayList containing Map.Entry pairs, where each pair consists of a category name (as a String) and the total quantity of items sold (as an Integer) for that category.

    • getPopularItems

      public static ArrayList<Map.Entry<String,Integer>> getPopularItems()
      Determines the top 10 most popular items based on quantity sold. This method queries the database to rank menu items by the total quantity sold, identifying the items that have been most popular with customers.
      Returns:
      An ArrayList containing Map.Entry pairs, where each pair consists of an item name (as a String) and the total quantity sold (as an Integer) for that item.
